CARDINAL . In DATE ORG took over those parts of the properties which were to be expropriated . In DATE Mr GPE sold other parts of the properties PERSON and PERSON CARDINAL:CARDINAL for FIM CARDINAL per square metre to a well - established service - station company intending to construct a new service station to replace the CARDINAL situated on adjacent land subject to expropriation .

CARDINAL . After reaching an agreement with ORG in DATE Mr GPE received FIM CARDINAL in compensation for the removal of the buildings , equipment and vegetation from the expropriated land . CARDINAL . The matter was then referred to the expert and the trustees who , on DATE , fixed the market value ( käypä arvo , gängse pris ) of the land at ORG CARDINAL.CARDINAL per square metre . They apparently arrived at this amount disregarding CARDINAL voluntary sales of land in the vicinity , as they considered that the sellers – Mr GPE and the municipality DATE had been “ in a dominant position ” at the time and thus able to dictate the price . CARDINAL . The applicants disputed the view of the expert and the trustees that Mr GPE and the municipality had been able to dictate the prices of the CARDINAL pieces of land previously sold to the service - station company . Even though Mr Jokela had sold his land at a price exceeding FIM CARDINAL per square metre , that had apparently not been considered excessive by the service - station company which otherwise could have asserted its right to redeem that land .

In their written submissions to ORG the applicants further stated their readiness to examine the executive secretary of GPE municipality ( V. ) as a witness in respect of the contents of the municipality 's above - mentioned offer of DATE , “ should ORG deem [ such an examination ] necessary ” .

On DATE the GPE and ORG ( lääninoikeus , länsrätten ) declined to examine the first applicant 's appeal ( as no inheritance tax had been imposed on her ) and dismissed the other applicants ' appeal in so far as it pertained to the market value of the properties . The court relied on sections CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Inheritance and LAW ( perintö- ja lahjaverolaki , lag om skatt på gåva och arv DATE ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) refused the applicants leave to appeal .

CARDINAL . In GPE the expropriation of real property for public use must be compensated according to its market value , that value being determined in the light of the general price level and the use to which the property was being put at the relevant time .

CARDINAL . By section CARDINALa of LAW ( laki yleisistä teistä , lag om allmänna vägar CARDINAL ) the compensation for expropriation must be determined in accordance with the criteria laid down in ORG ( laki kiinteän omaisuuden ja erityisten oikeuksien lunastuksesta , lag om inlösen av fast egendom och särskilda rättigheter CARDINAL DATE “ LAW ” ) . Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW provides that full compensation within the meaning of LAW is due for any expropriation , although such compensation may be adjusted according to the benefit to the remaining property which the road construction may produce .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW full compensation , corresponding to the market value , must be determined for the expropriated property . The time of the property transfer is decisive for the determination of this value . If the market value does not reflect the real loss sustained by the owner of the property or any related right , the assessment must be based on returns from the property or investments in it . If the purpose for which the expropriation is carried out has significantly increased or decreased the value of the property , the compensation due must be determined without taking this into account ( section CARDINAL ) . In practice , the market value is adjusted to take account of developments other than temporary price fluctuations , up to the end of the expropriation procedure .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL of the Inheritance and LAW provides that the assessment of inheritance tax must be based on the value of the property at the time of the death . The value of the property must be assessed in accordance with the provisions applicable to the taxation of income and capital gains ( sections DATE ) . Under the DATE LAW ( varallisuusverolaki , förmögenhetsskattelag DATE ) the assessment must be based on the market price of the property . In practice , the market value for the purpose of setting inheritance tax is the price which would most probably be paid for the particular property at the relevant location . The market price thus arrived at is normally reduced by PERCENT so as to avoid any overvaluation of the property at the time of the death .

CARDINAL . At the relevant time the competent Tax Commissioner ( verojohtaja , skattedirektören ) was under a duty to ensure , inter alia , that the value of the property subject to inheritance tax had been correctly assessed in the estate inventory ( section CARDINAL of the Inheritance and LAW ) . The tax was to be imposed by ORG after careful consideration of the information pertaining to the property , including commonly known facts such as the prevailing price levels in the municipality , and changes in the value of such property in general ( section CARDINAL as interpreted in practice ) . In DATE the inheritance tax boards were abolished and the imposition of this tax was assigned to the ordinary tax authorities ( Law no . CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . Under section CARDINAL of LAW ( jakolaki , lag om skifte CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , as in force at the relevant time , proceedings before the land courts were governed by the provisions applicable to the general courts , unless otherwise stated . In accordance with LAW ( oikeudenkäymiskaari , rättegångsbalken ) a land court could therefore decide not to admit evidence which was deemed to be irrelevant or had been proposed in order to prove an already established fact or where the evidence could be obtained in a significantly less cumbersome or cheaper manner ( LAW , section CARDINAL ) .
